results.title: Like you, like me: see what I feel
results.creator_credit: Alan P. Sloan and Encyclopaedia Britannica Educational Corporation
results.brief_description: An animated film which dramatises how a child copes with blindness. Designed to encourage discussion of attitudes toward the blind and to show that a blind or visually impaired child can do many things that other children do.

results.title: Like you, like me: I can do it
results.creator_credit: Alan P. Sloan, Avator Learning and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Shows how a child with an orthopaedic condition copes with braces. Suitable for primary and teacher/tertiary levels.

results.title: Toast
results.brief_description: Focuses on the excessive use of fossil fuels in the preparation and marketing of food by tracing the production and distribution of a loaf of bread. Also illustrates the concept of net energy profit.

results.title: Think twice: they're confusing you
results.brief_description: Illustrates kinds of faulty or misleading information, such as oversimplification, distortions of fact, and logical fallacies. Designed to encourage critical thinking about the information which permeates public and personal communication. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Read the label and live! - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Lee Rhoads and Alfred Higgins Productions
results.brief_description: Stressed the importance of reading labels on commonly used products and heeding the warnings and instructions on them. Dramatic sequences emphasize the most common problems that result when people do not read labels. Also details safe handling practices for hair sprays, insecticides, paint thinners, medicines and other household products.

results.title: Marketing the myths
results.brief_description: This film is a presentation of the best of four hundred television commercials submitted in a competition. Aims to assist in the study of television advertising and its influence on modern society and culture.

results.title: The Feminine mistake
results.creator_credit: Arnold Shapiro, Dave Bell Associates and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: A realistic look at what happens to women who smoke, showing young smokers, a pregnant woman, cancer victims, habitual smokers with wrinkled faces, and tests showing how one cigarette affects vital body organs. Shows a successful program in progress at one high school which is aimed at discouraging smoking among teenagers. Hosted by Bonnie Franklin

results.title: Family follies
results.creator_credit: Peter J Ketchum and Guidance Associates
results.brief_description: Uses a humorous skit with dances, songs, and production numbers in order to highlight the problems which trouble young people: communication with parents, developing responsibility and independence from parents, and learning to cope with competitive attitudes in the family. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: The Human journey: the family
results.creator_credit: Bob Conroy, CTV News and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description: Examines the evolution of the family as a social unit and discusses the problems resulting from modern families becoming increasingly smaller and more isolated. Suggests communal living, restructured neighbourhoods, and extended families as methods for making family life emotionally more comfortable.
